website_summaries.verdict: Google’s Nest WiFi makes blanketing your home in a fast, secure, and reliable wireless connection a snap.
pros: Huge coverage with 2,200 square feet per router and 1,600 square feet per point
cons: Adding points to your network will get pricey quickly

website_summaries.verdict: If you already make regular use of Google's products and services, then the Nest Wifi is a worthy splurge for a seamless and speedy connected home.
pros: The Google Nest Wifi is an excellent mesh router system with impressive top speeds, strong performance at range, easy-to-use features and stable band steering
The range-extending Nest Wifi Points come in your choice of three colors and double as Google Assistant smart speakers
cons: Similar mesh systems with comparable coverage can be had for less than half as much
Unlike the range extenders, the Nest Wifi Router only comes in white, and it only includes a single spare Ethernet jack

customer_reviews.title: SLOW speed, IMPOSSIBLE to separate bands
customer_reviews.text: This is all you need to know. Google WON'T allow you to separate the 2 wifi bands (2.4ghz and 5ghz). They "intelligently" select the best band for your devices. However, this means it almost always directs the 2.4ghz band (stronger band, but GROSSLY slower download speeds) to devices that are not right next to the router. This is ridiculous. I saw reduced speeds in all my 802.11ac devices around the house (2019 iPad Pros, Apple Macbook Pros, Mac Mini's, Windows PC's, everything). Typical speeds on my previous network with 4-year old router (anywhere in the house) = 244 Mbps Speed on Google Nest router (if more than 10 feet from router) = 40Mbps Returned this garbage right away.
customer_reviews.author: DVC

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT GET THIS PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to install and the signal strength is good if the product is not defective. One of the Google WiFi router that I bought kept rebooting after about 1 month of use. I contacted Google support and went through the tests that they suggested. It basically wasted 2 weeks and hours of my time. All I want is a product exchange at the end. They said they would have this escalated to the Product Specialist for the best course of action but never hear anything back from them.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew K.

customer_reviews.title: amazing!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently cancelled cable and downgraded to just wifi. unfortunately, their box got set up in the basement and they didn't want to drill holes coming from the floors so the router ended up in the basement. boy, was the connection horrible. our streaming on tv skipped and paused and did ghostly things. i tried extenders, that was even worse. before I bought a wifi that probably wouldn't work, i just said, f it, and got the Nest. I made the right choice. It was easy set up and get full bars all the way up to the second floor. Yeh, it's pricier than your average router, but you get what you paid for. it's a miracle!!!! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mihwa jo

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I have had the opportunity now to use this "nest" wifi system for a few months and I have to say, I am very disappointed with the speed! I have the fastest internet speed available (Gigablast) and the recommended modem but, where I'm let down is with this Google Nest wifi router system. Where I should be getting 500+mbps on wifi, I'm only getting 48-50mbps!?! Disappointing! I was getting much faster speeds from my old router when I had slower internet speeds. The wifi coverage is supposed to be 4400 sq. feet and it's having trouble in my 1300 sq foot Townhouse. Highly disappointed! I will never buy a Google Product again.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Carrillo

customer_reviews.title: Utter garbage. Did not work at all.
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping for a performance upgrade from my Eero. Bought the Nest. Impossible to Zoom or watch Netflix or even stream Tidal because of dropouts. Thought it might be my Spectrum modem. Got an Arris Surfboard 3.1. Was able to connect to the internet for a full five minutes before the light started blinking. Rebooted reset about 5 times, no dice. Spectrum useless as usual. Plugged my Eero back into the Arris, and it worked from the get-go. I'm sure the Nest works great for some, but I was shocked at how poorly it worked for me. Incompatible with TWO standard modems? Come on.
customer_reviews.author: T. Bombadil.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get caught in this mesh!!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolute garbage. Tried and tried with these units and they wrecked my network. Intermittent connectivity and even worse tech support. Since google bought nest it’s been all down hill. Steer clear!!
customer_reviews.author: NZ84

customer_reviews.title: Wifi-6 6 is still unstable....Get this!
customer_reviews.text: Speed is not everything! I had the original Google wifi and loved it. Since I got a gigabit speeds now I decided to try wifi 6 enabled devices. So first I tried Asus AX3000 not bad but it was the same speeds I was getting on the stock AT&T router on my 11 pro ( wifi 6 device) so i returned it. The tried the Netgear AX8 $300 router and was getting fast speeds close to 500 Mbps but completely unstable has to restart the router almost everyday even after talking to a netgear tech who told me to change the bands.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Google Nest WiFI needs to be a router and a point
customer_reviews.text: This packagge came as 2 routers instead of a router and a point. Because of this we had terriblle wifi signal throughout our home. After several calls to the tech support we have determined what needs to be done. Hopefully this will solve the issue. Last conversation with tech said it should be resolved within 2 to 3 hours. DO NOT order 2 routers if you are trying to set up a nest system! 10/3 After another day of waiting found out today Google Nest WiFi 2nd Gen has some serious kinks and the developers are rolling out not 1 but 2 major updates to correct issues. They hope to have all completed by October 12. We will see....
customer_reviews.author: Lenny

customer_reviews.title: The wifi performance blows my old router a way.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from TPLink OnHub. The wifi performance blows my old router a way. I have 3 routers and 1 point in a 3800 sq ft home and there are zero dead spots. I have 1gb service from Xfinity and I am now getting 850-900 Mbps download speeds throughout my entire house. My previous router with the same service and modem would only get 400 Mbps. Super easy to install and I love the auto upgrades.
customer_reviews.author: W33P

customer_reviews.title: Brings WiFi To Another Level In Our Home
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Google Nest Wifi 2-Pack since we have about 4000 sq feet in our home on 2 levels. We had never been able to pick wifi in the basement area since the distance from our cable modem was so great. I added one of the units to the connection with the cable modem and used the other with our TV at the opposite end of the house. With the exception of a very few limited occasions, the reception on all of our TV's has been exceptional. On the few occasions when the reception was poor, it appeared to be more atmospheric for whatever reason. However, this has been the rare exception rather than on a regular basis.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Reed

customer_reviews.title: Not much of an upgrade of google WiFi.
customer_reviews.text: I am a longtime google WiFi user and upgraded a 4 hard wired puck system from google WiFi to nest WiFi. I have gigabit internet and get about 900 Mbps hard wired, only 300 Mbps or so sitting 1 meter from the router using WIfi. The pucks are hard wired to each other so I was expecting much better. Essentially no better WiFi coverage or throughput. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Yas

customer_reviews.title: Works just like supposed to
customer_reviews.text: I got these and installed easily. I used 2 nest wifi and 3 google wifi devices. All work well. I had a problem last week and called google support. Not bad but they are in Philippines and not always easy to understand. Maybe she could not understand me but got it working. They called me back twice. I called Spectrum in between the two calls and did what they said and I got them working again. When I got the second call it was fixed already after I did what Spectrum told me to do. But these have great signal and work great. Love them. Buy them and you will not be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: If you have a house, you need a mash for your wifi
customer_reviews.text: Great product and works extremely well. Just watch out if you have the older version and you add a puck with the new version. The 2nd generation should be attached to your router to get the better Wifi strength. But that means you have to reinstall everything again. That is the moment when you learn how many wifi devices you have in your house :-)
customer_reviews.author: AK

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup! Dont believe other BS reviews!
customer_reviews.text: Don't listen to all the trash reviews saying you can't setup two of these routers as a mesh or that you need to hardwire them both to set it up. It's extremely easy and I got it all done in under 8 minutes. This even works better than the Netvear MK62 that has wifi 6 and gave me a ton of dropped signal in the same location I have my current Google Nest. Best budget mesh wifi system that does better than most of the slightly more expensive ones. Can't wait till they come out with a wifi 6 tri band!
customer_reviews.author: Steven D.

customer_reviews.title: Its working, barely!
customer_reviews.text: The Set Up CODE is embossed on the bottom of each unit so that it is so hard to read! And it is so small! It is ridiculous. They give you URLs to go to for help. How the heck are you going to get online if you're trying to SET UP YOUR ROUTER?? STUPID And there's no call line, no live person. Goodness Google is so large and has so much money that they could have customer service with live people. At least it's working through no fault of Google!! For how long I don't know yet.
customer_reviews.author: Fotopixl

customer_reviews.title: No support - does not work in a big house
customer_reviews.text: If you have few levels home with switches and lots of equipment connected via wire and wireless tíos product does not work ! Once install nothing seemed to work right . . . No customer service !!! No one to talk to ! Do not buy google product if you ever want support on your product !
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Two Router Combo better than Router+point
customer_reviews.text: Two Router Combo that is sold by Amazon is much better option than Router+point combo for many reasons. 1) Great WiFi Speeds over Mesh system as the hardware is the same in both. 2) Mesh System will have Ethernet port. I don't have issues setting up mesh system and didn't have to hardwired the mesh router to set it up. Just use the Google Home app to setup and you should be good. I followed these steps. First, setup just the main router to modem/source and then Power on the mesh router to setup without any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Sid

customer_reviews.title: Not good for new construction homes
customer_reviews.text: Definitely do not buy this version if you have a newly built home. It requires an address recognized by Google to start setup. Because of this, I can't set it up until google maps physically verifies that my house exists. I don't even need the smart home features.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with my purchase!
customer_reviews.text: This Nest Wifi 2 pack is great because it is 2 routers, not the common router and point bundle. Main difference is that it can be hardwired router to router with ethernet cable. The point does not have an ethernet port. Installation was perhaps the simplest setup for any smart device I have encountered. The signal is strong throughout the whole house now, utilizing both routers wirelessly. If you need multiple ethernet connections out of the router, you can add a switch to achieve that. With it being dual band, no more naming the 2.4 and 5 ghz bands separately. One network name and the device will connect appropriately for you. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Update to my previous review
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Received 2 routers but set the second one as the point in minutes. The Home app guided me through this. Plus I am using the ethernet port on the second point (router) for my VOIP which works very well. With my previous router, my VOIP call would drop often. Update (Dec 17): Now after using this for a month, I regret buying this. Very slow speed. My previous router was much better even though it was old by several years. I will be returning this. I am beginning to think Google should Just stick with the search engine alone and stop work on all others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Mesh Routers
customer_reviews.text: Best mesh system on the market for the price. Easy to install, great coverage, and high speeds. I bought the model that Amazon sells with two base units, as I wanted to use the Ethernet port on the secondary unit to connect a mini switch to. One complaint is you need two apps to run it, and the Google Home app is atrocious. They should scrap it and start over. The Google WiFi app is good, and they should stick only with that.
customer_reviews.author: RUSSELL

customer_reviews.title: Be ware, it doesn't have wifi 6!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I really did NOT want to like this since it did NOT have wifi 6. How could Google make this and NOT include wifi 6. However, it works so darn well that I'm keeping it. It's really hard to tell if a router is good since most of them do a great job 95% of the time. However, if you get a camera like the Wyze camera. You will be able to tell what a good router this is. This camera is solid almost 100% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Google fail.. limited features and full of regret
customer_reviews.text: So simple it has almost no adminstrative ability and none that work. No Mac filter, limited feature set. Setting a single priority device is such a lame feature and in concept and it doesn't even work. Prioritizing with standard QoS and being able to prioritize something other than typical gaming uses isn't an option. There are so many more administrative tools that should be included for this price. Will buy ubiquity
customer_reviews.author: Tim Alfano

customer_reviews.title: Never.
customer_reviews.text: Worked for about a day, and then stopped. What a WASTE. I tried a factory reset, and then connected them to the Ethernet, and it said that the internet connection failed and I needed to restart my router. Went through this with tech support for an hour to no avail.
customer_reviews.author: jdgallagher14

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Set Up; Ignore Old Reviews
customer_reviews.text: Do not listen for a second to reviews that say these are hard to install or require second routers to be connected via cable. Hogwash! I ordered these thinking it would be a gamble based on previous reviews, and it was dead simple to install. Plugged the first router into my modem and set it up within minutes. Second one in my bedroom similarly took little time with no hard network connection required. Couldn't have been much easier, and the connection speed difference in the remote parts of my house has been drastic. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Emery

customer_reviews.title: Needs a new firmware update...
customer_reviews.text: First off I LOVED my google WiFi until I switched it out die the nest WiFi. All my devices disconnect from the network every 5-10 minutes then i am forced to reset the network. This never ever happened on google WiFi. This is not an upgrade unless google comes out with a new firmware to fix this issue. Google, please fix this or I’m forced to go another route!
customer_reviews.author: Jason D Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Save your money, this is so terribly unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for a month or so now. Connection drops with monotonous regularity, and the only solution is to restart the network. Google suggest a number of ideas that are unworkable on most ISP routers, and thus the problem can't be fixed. I am ditching this and switching to another brand, I would not waste your money. Simply google (!) "Google Mesh Connection Problems" and you'll get the idea.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Lovegrove

customer_reviews.title: Known issues cause very slow speeds
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this router brought my wifi down to 30 mbps with my 1gb internet service and a wired connection was about 200mbps. I tried an Orbi and that got me around 300 mbps on wi-fi and 1.1 gbps on a wired connection. We spent a lot of time with Google tech support which were good but they says it is a known issue with the firmware. I would not buy this right now, I am returning.
customer_reviews.author: k2kennedy

customer_reviews.title: If you dont have a I phone expect to pay an extra $100 for a tech.
customer_reviews.text: Why does Google need to know so much personal info. just to set up router. Invasion of privacy. Will never buy another Google product. Their way or the hi way I will take the hi way.
customer_reviews.author: Larry McClain

customer_reviews.title: These things work awesome
customer_reviews.text: Saved my marriage (or at least the grumbling of my husband after dragging him to the middle of nowhere). Wifi before was 0.4 mbps. Tops. The download and ping rate was atrocious. Forget about any type of online anything. Signal could not reach down a flight of steps. Was paying for up to 5 mbps ( the only option for our rural area). Now I can play COD with no lag. I stream top quality and watch Netflix to my hearts content. Two routers cover my 1800 sq ft house. I get 4 mbps minimum on wifi. Just shy of 5 when hardwired in to the PS4. Worth the expense hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Amazed at the Performance
customer_reviews.text: I began researching these as an option to solve a client's Wi-Fi signal issues. The more I read the more I became intrigued at the possibility of them being THAT much better than the original. I had 4 of the original ones connected and still had a couple weak spots. I purchased and installed the pair of these and set them up within minutes. I am blown away at how well they work. Two of the new ones give me better coverage than 4 of the old ones! I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: James Tuttle

customer_reviews.title: Lots of coverage
customer_reviews.text: I had a linksys velop system that kept dropping. Replaced it with these and it is so much better! Large home, so I needed 3 total. Covers the whole house with no dead spots. Connects out to the garage for the garage door openers, into the yard for the security system cameras, and all devices really well. Have the main one by the router in a cupboard and it still gets wifi out to the other units and throughout the house. Very glad I updated.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Best Nest System
customer_reviews.text: We bought a 4 unit package for our church two years ago. It has given us great WiFi coverage over our large campus. Even after power outages, it resets itself and has been trouble free. I just bought a 2 unit package for my home. Great coverage; no issues. I'm a tech guy and I love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gary's Aloha

customer_reviews.title: Quick to set up, easy to use, great coverage
customer_reviews.text: I have two buildings on a third of an acre. Got this set up in under 30 minutes and now enjoy coverage everywhere on the property. It took three or four tries for the second node to find the first one, but I just repeated the process and then they paired just fine. Much better coverage and throughput than with the less expensive Meshforce system I had before.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Clark

customer_reviews.title: great simple router
customer_reviews.text: Had the previous google onhub router but it was having trouble getting signal everywhere in the house now that i have added google homes to every room in the house. With the new and more powerful Nest Wifi router and point this is not a problem. Great signal everywhere in the house now. Very simple to get up and running in no time. Love this router.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Best so far
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a half dozen routers in the past 3 years, all shape and form, Linksys, Asus, Netgear, but this google mesh system has been the most stable, reliable, and fastest. The vast majority of routers that I owned were horrible: random disconnects, some devices not connecting, slow, 5ghz band not working. etc, but I fave none of those problems with this and it is also very easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: M. Adnan

customer_reviews.title: Worked good for two days then quit
customer_reviews.text: The router worked good for two days then quit. Had to return for a replacement. Was easy to set up after I downloaded and setup the Google Home app.
customer_reviews.author: Buff

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up but speed is not great for the price. Get the TP link deco m9 instead
customer_reviews.text: Signal is ok with wired backhaul. Without wired backhaul you see a significant speed decrease on the node. Would only recommend for people with wired backhaul. Bought the 2 routers pack instead of the 1 router and 1 point to wired backhaul. Set up was a breeze but not the best performance. Was testing this vs the deco m9 and went with the deco m9 with 3 nodes and cheaper price with better performance. Google products is overrated you can get cheaper and better option with the TP link deco m9
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Expected these to be much faster
customer_reviews.text: I think these must only be for increasing mobile speed because they didn't do squat to increase the internet speed on my laptop. In several speed tests it was actually worse than the basic AT&T router. I have three of these in a mesh point and have 1gig internet speeds on the LAN connections. So sad.
customer_reviews.author: TexasPickles

customer_reviews.title: Simple, Effective, Powerful
customer_reviews.text: The Google WiFi overall has been an excellent upgrade for us, as the single AP wasn't cutting it for upstairs smart TV's, laptops, and tablets. This combines both the 2.4 and 5 GHz bands into one that decides which is better for each device, making accessing our TV's and smart devices from our phone easier than ever. The best part of this pack is the second router allows not only a dedicated wired backchannel between routers, but also a wired access for devices that are far away from the traditional wall outlet/router and can now connect to the second AP.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Didn't increase speed, will probably return
customer_reviews.text: Installation was easy. I set them up as two wired routers. My old router was only four years old, but it would just cut out entirely sometimes. So far these two mesh devices are working, but only at the same speed as the old one. Which is fine, but the device's app (Google Home) tests the speed as about 15 times faster than speedtest.net. So that's a little sleazy programming. Not impressed. For $300, I will probably return them.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn  Customer

customer_reviews.title: Improvement over Google Wifi version 1
customer_reviews.text: bought to replace google wifi version 1 and using that previous router as a wifi point. Was a bit confusing to learn that that one must use a different app -- google wifi no more, now use nest wifi. Had to factory reset the version 1 google wifi to make it work as a wifi point. This didn't go smoothly so had to call customer service which was a very good experience. They walked me through it quickly and I was up and running in about 20-25 minutes. Expected everything to just work given its a google product but was impressed by the customer service and overall coverage after this upgrade is better. I would recommend. Big Google/Nest wifi fan.
customer_reviews.author: David Boole

customer_reviews.title: Perfect solution to large house
customer_reviews.text: We have a large home and continually had issues. We utilized 2 internet companies, one on bottom floor and second for the second floor. After installing, we dropped one of the internet companies and the system works better than before. We were not able to stream movies on our 2 internet system, but now with the Nest system everything is awesome and we are saving $60 per month. Win-Win!
customer_reviews.author: Vickiejo

customer_reviews.title: Should have upgraded sooner!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Gave us the flexibility we needed to be able to hardwire my wife's work computer in the back of our house, just added a switch to the 2nd router. We couldn't get our cable company to drop a hard line in our office so we changed the game plan. Works GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: J Thrasher

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and strong signal
customer_reviews.text: We use this 2 pack in a 3400 sq. ft. ranch style home. One centrally located on the main floor and one in the basement. The setup is easy. Both are technically routers but one serves as an access point. By both being routers, they both have ethernet ports. This is advantageous if you need to hardwire a device not located near the "router". We get coverage throughout our whole property. We have 3 acres.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Easy and strong signal. Very good software
customer_reviews.text: Strong Signal. Easy to setup. This version is two routers. Both are hard wired. One is the master. Really like the controls. Am able to group my kids Wifi and restrict sites and time. If shopping competitor products, be sure to check what controls / monitoring are included without extra cost. Many competitors charge extra.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Another home run Google.
customer_reviews.text: As a middle school teacher who spent the last half of the school year online teaching, I recently found out how incredibly crappy our internet is. After many hours on the phone with tht ISP, I bought this out of frustration. Also out of hearing raving reviews of this product. IT IS WORTH THE BIG PRICE TAG! Our internet woes are a thing of the past. I can easily monitor our network, I have Ethernet access several places in the house now, and I can still use wifi a block away!
customer_reviews.author: Connor M.

customer_reviews.title: Isn't what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: First, this was not the router-hub pair. Those are 2 routers! They work together anway...but I was expecting the other hub with the google assistance speaker. This package doesn't have the speaker. Secondly, the signal gets jammed and many times doesn't reach all around my apartment (concrete walls). Usually it is working...but suddenly the pair lose connection with each other. After some research...it seems they are greatly affected by neighbor's wifi (just like any dumb router). disappointed in google again
customer_reviews.author: Hosam Mostafa

customer_reviews.title: Great Product....very bad costumer service
customer_reviews.text: very good product while it worked. After 7 months of use, it began to lost signal and i contacted Google directly and they guided me trough some troubleshooting protocols they have. I have been sharing emails and phone calls with them for almost 2 months and the problem persists. I decided today that im going to buy a new mesh system but not a Google branded since they have very good intentions to help but to be honest, having a call center based in philliphines just make the things harder for them and for us. No solution to my problem yet.
customer_reviews.author: Julio

customer_reviews.title: 2 Routers? No "Point"
customer_reviews.text: This is ridiculous. Why would anyone buy 2 routers for one house? The video shows a router and a "point." This does not contain a point. Ironic? Sending back and buying from competitor website. Amazon does not appear to sell "points."
customer_reviews.author: eham

customer_reviews.title: Simple
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what others experienced but I received these (along with a Netgear router to replace the rental) and setup was a breeze. No issues following the on screen prompts to setup the point and the mesh point. The most time consuming part was waiting on Xfinity to activate the new router. The most annoying part was getting all the devices (TVs, Rokus, Sonos, etc) switched to the new network. I'm getting exactly the speeds I pay for wirelessly, and the 2nd point gets us perfect signal in a corner of the house that we had issues with previously, and we'll get better signal on the deck now.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: It does exactly what it's supposed to!
customer_reviews.text: We replaced a Netgear Nighthawk due to lack of coverage. The 2-pack Nest Wifi was amazingly simple to install and configure: plug in the router, download the app, set up the router, add the 2nd one and that's it done. Very fast, blanket coverage of our home, no bells and whistles, just an excellently engineered mesh system by Google. Couldn't find anything to fault.
customer_reviews.author: A. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Will not connect
customer_reviews.text: I would say save your time and money. This router is very frustrating and will not connect if you have a static IP. The app will immediately crash and the tech-support from Google is next to useless. Nobody can figure out how to get this to work even though my current Internet router with Apple Airport extreme has been working flawlessly for seven years.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and definitely works as a mesh network despite other reviews!
customer_reviews.text: I’m reading through the other reviews about how these are hard to setup.. definitely not the case! Had mine setup and running in about a half hour. First one you need to plug into your current modem.. second access point you add via camera code and the software will guide you through the rest. Very simple
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Google Nest Wifi Rocks
customer_reviews.text: I saw some people that were not really that positive on this product. I went from barely a signal in my basement office to max signal. Now I have max signal throughout my house and when I run a speed test the rating for my internet is very fast. This product was very easy to set up. Took less than 30 minutes to install three of these Google Nest Routers. Buy it and your weak signal problems will be solved. If not it is your providers router or service.
customer_reviews.author: Donald McClara

customer_reviews.title: If you game do not purchase.
customer_reviews.text: If anyone plays games on ps4 Xbox or switch say goodbye to connectivity. If you browse or print then this will work for you. Great coverage no doubt about it but what good is that WHEN YOU CANT CONNECT TO ANYTHING!!!!!! This is my second time trying this product and I am sooo disappointed. Sending it back. Nice try google. Continue trying to deliver products that only accommodate the basic user. Your market is 60+. Back to the drawing board for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very stable. Great user interface. Great design.
customer_reviews.text: The reviews are not lying when they say this is the best wifi router in the market today. The app is very well designed and quite useful. Very good stability. Did not have to reboot in a month (I had to reboot my old router every few days). I connected two units with PLC backhaul as they are at far corners of the house and the mest signal is weak. Works great in that configuration.
customer_reviews.author: R. Prakash

customer_reviews.title: Best wifi we ever had!
customer_reviews.text: We had an older (first edition) Eero system, that wasn't fast enough, so I replaced it with this one. The Google Nest Wifi is much faster. We were paying for 500 down but only got 150 until we installed this Google Nest system, now we get the full 500. 2 units cover our entire house. It works great, never any problems. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: cwp

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT PURCHASE. Firmware update renders useless. Cannot Return.
customer_reviews.text: The Google Nest system only works sporadically and not when you need it. Can not be counted on when you need it (trying to run a business) $350 down the drain, now can't return it, plus lost several days productivity & revenue trying to troubleshoot. DO NOT PURCHASE! *Will amend my review if I can return this for a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: DCM

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than the previous model
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace the Google WiFi previous generation I have, and these work better, I see better signal strength and faster speeds. I only replaced 2 of my 3 old ones, the old one still works in mesh with these. The app to manage them is pretty good and simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to get great speed and range
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to set up and dramatically increased the range and speed of our wifi. Bought 4 routers to set up a mesh network. We have an old 1890s farm house. Cable modem is at the front of our house where main router sits. Put another router upstairs near the middle of the house, one in the back bathroom, then another in the back yard shed. We now have great signal throughout the house and by our backyard pool. Should have done this awhile ago...
customer_reviews.author: Cliff E.

customer_reviews.title: works fine
customer_reviews.text: easy to install but the parental control system it is a little bit more complex i will love a more flexible like time to assign rather than simply a window time
customer_reviews.author: Diego T.

customer_reviews.title: A good signal strength upgrade on google wifi
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this router two pack to replace my google wifi three puck system as I was experiencing a poor signal in some parts of the yard. I purposely got two routers so I could have a wired back haul as with my google wifi. The setup was very easy and the reception is much improved and I now get 300mbit results over wifi on speedtest.net with my fiber connection.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Wong

customer_reviews.title: Extremely powerful - low attenuation
customer_reviews.text: I had google WiFi in the house which was good - but these google Nest WiFi routers blew me away. I wanted a stronger signal in my house and while I had 4 of the google WiFis it wasn’t getting everywhere and attenuated drastically through walls. I added just one of these Google nest WiFi devices and suddenly had 4 bars throughout the home. I went ahead and added the second one because o bought it - but just the one was far more powerful than anticipated.
customer_reviews.author: RockerDown

customer_reviews.title: Was working great until 12871.57.12 update
customer_reviews.text: This was working great until the 12871.57.12 update. Now, the wifi speed degrades until it comes to a crawl. The speed is restored if you restart them - for a few hours. As usual, Google support is non-existent. Until a better firmware comes up, I have 2 expensive paperweights.
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: Excellent router and mesh
customer_reviews.text: Installed six of these in a 6500 sq ft ranch with many plaster walls, one as a router and five as Ethernet connected access points. Installation was straightforward. This replaced an Xfinity router (now in bridged mode) and six Apple Airport Extremes. In spite of one less access point, coverage is better. Anywhere in a room where there is an access point speeds are 400-500 with an iPhone X. In rooms next to these speed is 200-300. System seems excellent particularly if you can use Ethernet to build the mesh, since these don’t have a dedicated back haul channel.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Arango

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste you money on system extenders get this system...
customer_reviews.text: All reports explaining the Google Nest Mesh are true ... Pricey but worth every bit.... System works great as of yet no need for tech support.... Very simple setup... If you are experiencing dead stops with your WiFi system do not waste your money on extenders but get a mesh system....the google nest is a great product...
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to setup great performance
customer_reviews.text: COVID has put a real network and bandwidth strain on my household. Installing the Google Nest wifi has resolved all my issues. If you have an confusion with the install I recommend one of the many YouTube video. The only thing I struggled with was my smart phone did not always read the QPR codes on the devices easily.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Mann

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, works extremely well
customer_reviews.text: This is extremely well done. Prior to this, I had no WiFi signal in half my house and my kid was always complaining about his ping. Setting these up was very easy with the google home app and the WiFi works extremely well and fast. Best yet, no more “ping” complaints. I also like you can put the Internet on a schedule in the house with the app.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfie

customer_reviews.title: Works the best and installation is basic and done with ease!
customer_reviews.text: 100% recommended. Doubled my internet WiFi range with stronger speeds!! Install took about 5 minutes with a cell phone. No hardwire ethernet connection needed for install. 1000% recommended for anyone, including non-tech savy individuals! Tech support was not reviewed as they were not contacted.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Y.

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these Google Nest WiFi routers based on a friends recommendations. He said he and his whole family had the same thing and were extremely happy with them. I must say... I am just as happy as he is! The set up process was easy enough for me to do, for which I am grateful. They were not cheap but if they last for 5 years, that's not that much money per year. Now I have a strong signal that gives high speed EVERYWHERE in my house!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Holbrook

customer_reviews.title: 😤😤😤
customer_reviews.text: Problems with compatibility with other Google products, software and hardware. Plus all other non-Google Wifi hardware. Everything is less than a year between installations. It "bounces" between 2.4 and 5 with long wifi downtime. Tired of hearing everyone in my house complain. I feel sorry for tech support.
customer_reviews.author: DNC

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best! Do not even consider another product. Returned a competitor brand given that it would not connect and tech support not helpful. Google is the only way to go.
customer_reviews.author: WNP Work

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to set up. Sends good signal throughout my 2,600 sf home and even some coverage outside. Good smartphone app to test internet speed, control access to Wi-Fi network, and set priority device if desired.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT L. SMITH JR

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work very well
customer_reviews.text: I needed an upgrade from my existing cable company supplied router and tried this out. So far it is working extremely well and the installation was not that difficult using the Google Home app. It helps if you have some familiarity with the app, and you do have to add each router to the Home app as an individual device but they sync up on their own to determine which one is the master. It has definitely extended the wifi range around my home (3000 sq ft) and even into the backyard for about 30 ft. Wifi speeds are much faster than the original router from the cable company. Recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory M.

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY NEST WIFI if you have Gigabit internet
customer_reviews.text: Nest wiif is incapable to deliver fast speed through wifi. It can handle up to 400M. If you have any speed plan above this mark, you are trying to suicide. I spent 5 hours with google support, they are terrible. They blame everything on your ISP even you told them everything is fine. JUST DONT BUY it, I learned the hard way!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Life savers for remote school and work
customer_reviews.text: Our WiFi was not strong enough in places around our house where we are working. I bought this set and an additional google WiFi point and our WiFi signal is amazing. No more weak signal. They were very easy to set up. We have 3 floors that need strong WiFi and this solved our problem.
customer_reviews.author: Miranda Landry

customer_reviews.title: Just works, best mesh network imo.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely excellent, easy to setup, easy to control, great performance! I tried Linksys Velop before these and was extremely disappointed signals kept getting dropped, nodes kept getting lost. So I decided to try these google nests and everything just works GREAT!
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Simple setup Great coverage
customer_reviews.text: This router system was very simple to setup. The App needed for installation makes the job easy. But, this is still a network change and you must reattach all your clients to the new network. Better know your devise names and passwords. Networks are not easy to establish, but the improved capability was worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Erie

customer_reviews.title: Great wifi mesh
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this set to supplement my first generation of google wifi mesh. I learned that the newer devices must be the bridge in order for them to all worked together. Once this change was made, everything works great. The network speed is pretty good and the connection is extremely stable.
customer_reviews.author: Bass

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what Google promises
customer_reviews.text: I needed to upgrade my coverage and was considering one of the newer WiFi 6 mesh systems. However, decided to wait for WiFi 6E and set up a Google Nest WiFi Mesh network as a less expensive interim solution. I bought Nest WiFi routers to use as the router and as access points so that I can use ethernet to backhaul data (Nest WiFi points don't have ethernet ports - only Nest WiFi routers do), and it is working great. Set up was easy. If you want to use ethernet for backhaul, I found it best to set up the router as an access point on the mesh network before plugging in the ethernet cable.
customer_reviews.author: K W

customer_reviews.title: works better than i imagined
customer_reviews.text: On day one.... It was very very very easy to install. literally plug in, download app, and follow the steps. I was originally nervous about the set up. Had the kids test out the previously dead zones of the house and works beautifully. Even better, you can pause the WiFi on devices linked to it. So it is easier to pause the games the kids are using :) so far so good, I am thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Salazar-Kocher

customer_reviews.title: Extends Wi-Fi across yard
customer_reviews.text: Wifi much faster across entire house and now extends throughout yard. Way better than original router plus netgear wifi extender.
customer_reviews.author: afish

customer_reviews.title: Much better
customer_reviews.text: Have great coverage and speed with 3 routers. My VoIP doesn't drop anymore regardless of where I work in my home.
customer_reviews.author: Jasper

customer_reviews.title: Finally able to get WIFI outside house
customer_reviews.text: I've spent several hundreds of dollars trying to extend my WIFI to my outdoor living space with no success. This product was recommended to me so I thought I would give it a try. For the first time in 9 years, I can get WIFI outside. SO HAPPY! Installation was easy and no issues in 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie B

customer_reviews.title: awful
customer_reviews.text: This product doesn't work, gets to the end and then fails setup. Google support blamed the ISP, my isp set to bridge mode therea no filtering straight to a modem. Dont buy this, don't listen to people saying to buy this, the Google mesh is actual garbage and I'm returning it for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P.

customer_reviews.title: Great mesh system.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mesh system. I prefer this setup over the router and point. I didn’t need google assistant and the two routers have more antennas and power. Used this to replace cable company provided WiFi equipment. Huge upgrade. Has worked great. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory D

customer_reviews.title: Made my google WiFi even better
customer_reviews.text: Replacing the main router with this and then using my older Google WiFi was a great increase to our coverage and speeds. The two pack of routers both have hard wired connections too. The Google Home app for setup is a little buggy in iOS, but just keep trying and eventually it works.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Brown

customer_reviews.title: Very poor throughput
customer_reviews.text: Throughput is only 33% of the original signal. Either Wired or wireless, makes absolutely no difference. Not worth the money.A lot of information on the web regarding this problem with Google.
customer_reviews.author: William M. Cobb

customer_reviews.title: Google Nest produces a great mesh network.
customer_reviews.text: Added these to an existing Google wifi Gen. 1 system. Using a total of 5 access points now to cover 2 stories and over 5,300 sf with no issues. Love being able to plug computers and TVs directly into the access points.
customer_reviews.author: Kds4

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy if you’re looking for fast WiFi Speed
customer_reviews.text: I have 1Gbps coming from my modem and only get 80mbps, even after upgrading the supplied CAT5 to a CAT6 cable going from the modem to the router. Have to reboot the router at least once a week because it stops working.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my small office. No networking experience needed.
customer_reviews.text: I set this up in my small office. Set up was quick and easy. No experience necessary. Signal strength is great with just one module covering about 2000 SF. I did have one issue a few weeks after I set it up and tried adding a copier. Had to call customer service. Technician was great and walked me through everything. Ended up having to reset the router but it has worked great ever since!
customer_reviews.author: curiousltlkitten

customer_reviews.title: Powerful device
customer_reviews.text: Great product and easy to install and use. I had the previous model and I upgraded to this one and oh wow what a difference it makes. The signal is much stronger specially over WiFi. Highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Tupackobe

customer_reviews.title: Strong signal, fast setup
customer_reviews.text: Great coverage, just what I needed to extend network from one end of the house to my office. Setup was quick, under 10 minutes. Firmware upgrade probably took the longest amount of time during setup. Second unit has an option for wired connection, which is nice and I was able to connect my desktop to it without need for WiFi. It will not cover 4000+ sqf as estimated, but under 3000 it's perfect. There are no advanced control options, just basic routing. It's all I need though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Relief welcomed !!
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup! Extended and much improved Wi-Fi strength !! Between my son working from home, my daughter taking summer classes on line this product upped our Wi-Fi to a place where we finally felt normal again. Highly recommend !
customer_reviews.author: George Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and fast WiFi signal
customer_reviews.text: At first I was concerned about this product because of some of the reviews posted about difficult setup. I did not find this at all. Both installed exactly as directions stated and step by step instructions frown Google Home app. I was pleasantly surprised that the WiFi speed equaled hardline speed. Great mesh system and easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great router, but why a 2-pack of them?
customer_reviews.text: Great google nest wi-fi router product but no need to buy as a pair. One router is enough for our home use. It would be better if the google nest wi-fi router came paired with google nest extender point to better strong wi-fi reception to far distant corners of the house.
customer_reviews.author: rkeylogic

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: 3 pack. two work fine ,but one will not work . Pain in the but to send back so looks like I paid for 3 but get to use two
customer_reviews.author: Col

customer_reviews.title: PLEASE READ THIS INFORM YOURSELF ABOUT THE SELLER
customer_reviews.text: Ok so I'm going to get right into it. The google WiFi is insanely fast in my opinion. However, the seller DID NOT MENTION that if you want to buy a 2 pack you should be receiving the ROUTER AND POINT with Google Assistant. NOT 2 ROUTERS. For that I can purchase one router and call it a day. Very sneaky tactic in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Moreta

customer_reviews.title: Amazing coverage, easy setup, can't split networks
customer_reviews.text: Extremely simple to set up, great coverage, absolutely the best wifi coverage I've every had in a residential setting. My only complaint is the inability to split the network in to 2.4ghz and 5ghz networks. I have some IoT devices that require a 2.4ghz connection and the workarounds are time consuming and complicated
customer_reviews.author: MrClean402

product_meta.title: Google Nest WiFi Router 2 Pack (2nd Generation) – 4x4 AC2200 Mesh Wi-Fi Routers with 4400 Sq Ft Coverage
product_meta.description: Style:2-Pack[1] Home size, materials and layout can affect how Wi-Fi signal travels. Larger homes or homes with thicker walls or long, narrow layouts may need extra Nest Wifi devices for full coverage. Strength and speed of signal will depend on your internet provider. [2] This is based on only using connected devices at a data rate of 1 Mbps each. Requires sufficient broadband internet connection and connected devices to be located within Wi-Fi coverage area described at g. co/nestwifi/coverage. Strength and speed of signal will also depend on your internet provider. [3] Strength and speed of signal will depend on your internet provider.
feature_bullets: This product includes two router units.

Nest Wifi is a scalable and flexible Wi-Fi system. These Nest Wifi devices work together to blanket your whole home in fast, reliable Wi-Fi and eliminate buffering in every room – with coverage up to 4400 square feet.[1]

One Wi-Fi router plugs into your internet provider’s modem to create your Wi-Fi network. The other extends the wireless network and keeps your connection fast to devices in every room. For more coverage, add Nest Wifi routers or points to your system.

Nest Wifi routers are strong enough to handle up to 200 connected devices, and fast enough to stream multiple 4K videos at a time.[2] Compatible with Google Wifi; Ethernet ports included on each router 15W power adapter.

Intelligently works behind the scenes to make sure your Wi-Fi remains fast.[3] Walk from room to room on a video call with an uninterrupted signal Nest Wifi  automatically updates itself to get new features and help your network stay safe and sound.

Nest Wifi is easy to set up in the app.[4] Easily create a guest network and share your password in just a few taps. Decide which devices to prioritize for faster speeds and use parental controls to manage online time for the kids.
Please refer to the product description section below for all applicable legal disclaimers denoted by the bracketed numbers in the preceding bullet points (e.g., [1], [2], etc.)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,037 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
